skill.name: streaming-llm-responses
skill.description:
Implement real-time streaming UI patterns for AI chat applications. Use when adding response
lifecycle handlers, progress indicators, client effects, or thread state synchronization.
Covers onResponseStart/End, onEffect, ProgressUpdateEvent, and client tools.
NOT when building basic chat without real-time feedback.

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill with no executable code. The verify.py script only checks file existence. No network calls, file writes, credential access, or command execution detected.

content.value_statement: Users struggle to build responsive chat interfaces that update in real-time as AI responses stream. This skill provides code patterns for lifecycle handlers, progress indicators, and client-side effects to create smooth streaming experiences.
actual_capabilities: Add real-time progress update events during AI processing
Send fire-and-forget client effects from server to UI
Define client tools for AI to query browser state
Handle thread lifecycle events for persistence
Lock UI during streaming to prevent race conditions
limitations: Does not include backend server implementation
Requires a compatible streaming library like useChatKit
Does not handle authentication or user management
Frontend code examples are TypeScript/React specific

use_cases.title: Build streaming chat UI
use_cases.description: Create responsive chat interfaces with progress indicators and live updates as AI responses stream token by token.

use_cases.title: Design real-time feedback
use_cases.description: Architect communication patterns between AI agents and client UIs using effects and client tools.

use_cases.title: Sync thread state
use_cases.description: Implement thread lifecycle management with client and server coordination for seamless conversation persistence.

prompt_templates.title: Basic streaming setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to set up streaming response handlers in a React chat component. Include onResponseStart and onResponseEnd callbacks.

prompt_templates.title: Progress indicators
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I use ProgressUpdateEvent to show status messages during AI processing? Give a Python backend example.

prompt_templates.title: Client effects
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain client effects vs client tools. Show how to send a fire-and-forget effect from the server to update the UI.

prompt_templates.title: Client tools
prompt_templates.prompt: How can the AI read client-side state like selected items or map viewport? Show the full pattern for client tools.

output_examples.input: How do I lock the UI while the AI is responding and show a loading indicator?
output: Use onResponseStart to lock UI and show loading state
Use onResponseEnd to unlock UI and hide loading indicator
Always handle onError to unlock UI on failures

best_practices: Always unlock the UI in error handlers to prevent frozen interfaces
Keep effect handlers lightweight and fire-and-forget for performance
Use requestAnimationFrame for DOM updates in onEffect callbacks
anti_patterns: Not locking UI during response leads to race conditions and double-submissions
Blocking in effects causes streaming to pause waiting for UI updates
Heavy computation in onEffect handlers degrades streaming performance

faq.question: What frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: The examples use React with TypeScript. Patterns apply to any frontend framework with equivalent state management.

faq.question: What is the maximum streaming message length?
faq.answer: Message length limits depend on your backend API. The skill focuses on UI patterns, not backend constraints.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing chat components?
faq.answer: Add lifecycle handlers to your existing chat component configuration. Effects and tools integrate alongside current handlers.

faq.question: Is user data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: The skill provides patterns only. Data handling depends on your API configuration. No data leaves your configured endpoints.

faq.question: Why is my progress indicator not showing?
faq.answer: Ensure ProgressUpdateEvent is yielded during async processing, not just at the start and end. Backend must emit events.

faq.question: How does this compare to native streaming APIs?
faq.answer: This skill provides higher-level patterns. Native streaming (Server-Sent Events) handles transport; these patterns handle UI state.
